newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish NFI Piast plans to up its capital in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Polish NFI Piast plans to up its capital in 1997.

text.p: Polish National Investment Fund (NFI) No 12 or Piast wants to increase its share capital this year, the fund's president said on Wednesday.
"We would like to raise the share capital of the fund, we would like it this year, but it will depend on our future shareholders," Rafal Zagorny told Reuters in an interview.
He did not give any details.
Zagorny said the fund's strategy envisaged focusing on three sectors chemical, car parts and textiles. @
He said the fund did not plan to place any of its companies on the bourse this year, but said it would look for investors for its automotive parts and chemical companies.

"This year two or three joint venture projects are possible - one of them in chemical and one in car parts sector...as far as textiles are concerned, it seems, the firms can cope themselves," Zagorny said.
